moves.1. d4: After learning 1. e4 opening, Now a day i am practicing queens Pawn opening with several variation. So 1. d4
moves.1... d5: He stuck directly in the center that is ok but little bit unusual for me because when i open with d4 the usual response of maximum player here is Nf6.
moves.2... c6: gambit decline and a perfect response with c6. The other option may be defend d5 with Nf6.
moves.3. Nc3: I continue developing and putting pressure on d5.
moves.3... Nf6: So the he continue developing and defending d5 with Nf6.
moves.4. Bg5: whenever opportunity comes I am always happy to pin the knight (BTW it is still not pinned against black queen due to e7 pawn) rather than develop any of bishop on f4 or c4.
moves.4... e6: So he add another defender to d5 if in case his knight at f6 fall. Although, I never want an exchange of bishop with Knight at f6 or c6 unless it is forced or make opponent position week after exchange.
moves.5. e3: With e3 i an now able to develop my lsb but i will be very cautious to loss of tempo in this variation. Particularly, after development of bishop at d3 black just take c4 pawn to force me to regain material equality but lose tempo.
moves.5... Nbd7: He continues developing. This is another move i like to play if opportunity comes as connected knight are very good combo.
moves.6. Qc2: Qc2!!!!. at the time of making this move my main purpose to confuse my opponent and guessing his intent of attack. See, not a single piece of king side out from the hut. They are still sleeping.
moves.6... Qa5: after black response of Qa5,  i realize Qc2 is an inaccuracy because black intent is clear to use pin of my knight at c3 and exploit my queen side.
moves.7. a3: oops!!! another inaccuracy as suggest by post game computer analysis at chess.com. Analysis suggest a better line as  (7. Nf3 7... Bb4 8. Bxf6 8... Nxf6 9. Bd3 9... dxc4 10. Bxc4 10... Nd5 11. Bxd5 11... exd5)
moves.7... Ne4: of course wtih Ne4 black start to multi threaten me as i also do something to my dsb at d5.
moves.8. Bf4: SO i just move to a safer place.
moves.8... Be7: Analysis suggest this is first inaccuracy from black side. The better one he suggest is immediate g5.
moves.9. Bd3: So i am going to take this knight???
moves.9... Ndf6: Black combination is good here he keep active his most favorite position e4.
moves.10. f3: Where my common sense goes and why not my favorite Ne2. Computer analysis rated this as a mistake.
moves.11... dxc4: So he another loss of tempo as i am not too aware for this. He takes
moves.12... Nd5: after some nice play with Knight by black i feel very irritated and take the knight without considering any damage.  So i take
moves.15... Ba6: This is another excellent move by black. Threaten to take my knight at e2 and weakening c3 paw.
moves.16. Rf2: Instead of Re1 i made Rf2. Looking any chance of doubling the rook.
moves.16... Rc8: oops black decided to come out with all resources and now my queen feel uncomfortable
moves.17. e4: So i counter attack in the center. I don't know why black waiting to exchange knight at e2, coz knight exchange at e2 give him a clear advantage
moves.17... O-O: He prefer to secure his king before commencing a tough fight
moves.18. Bd2: meanwhile, I found this better move, The idea was forcing the queen to retreat after c3-c4
moves.18... Rc4: But he guess my plan and so Rc4 to block pawn push also threatening me to double the rook.
moves.19. exd5: Again computer rate this as inaccuracy but i consider this as a pretty good exchange.
moves.19... exd5 20. Qf5: So queen in main battle field but for how much time
moves.20... Bc8: no no not for much time. I also activate his dull bishop at C4 but somehow i avoid the chance of doubling the rook .
moves.21. Qc2: unable to find a good square so queen back to his position and play defender role only.  Dear reader please suggest a best square for queen here
moves.21... Ra4: so he now going to take material advantage .
moves.22. Nf4: any way i am looking for some counter play opportunity
moves.23. Rxa3 Bxa3 24. c4: after this move i am more than happy to keep myself in the game see how
moves.24... Bb4 25. Bxb4 Qxb4 26. Nxd5: That knight is at right time at right place
moves.26... Qe1+ 27. Rf1 Qe6 28. Qe4: I thought queen exchange here and three central pawn is very good for me in endgame
moves.28... Qd7: he decline and now i am start capitalizing see how
moves.29. Qe5 Bb7: No way i do not want to exchange this very active knight
moves.30. Ne7+ Kh8: gain a tempo and make very good move Re1. why i first deny Re1 earlier and made Rf2
moves.31. Re1 a5: His free pawn start rolling over
moves.32. c5: but i never allowed this pawn to reach his destination, and play some beautiful move till end and force opponent to resign.
Till this move game is pretty balanced as suggested by chess.com computer analysis.
moves.35... h6 36. Qe4 a4 37. Qg4 g6 38. Nxh6: Chess computer analysis rate this game costing blunder.
moves.40. Nf5+ Kf8 41. Qh4 Qxe5 42. dxe5 gxf5: Thanks for reading. Please rate this annotation in rating system and suggest through comment.
